item.title: Moonwalk Away : Ear Candy
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: When I came back from South Africa four years ago one of the only tangible memories I brought back with me was a CD by a band named Goldfish : an electronica and dance group hailing from Cape Town. Last night at the #WMCFW I fell in love with one of the runway songs (seriously, the music was […]

item.title: The Best Things Are Bitter-Sweet : Garlic Roasted Radicchio
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: For most things that are bitter by nature, they must be dolled up in different ways so that the harshness is pleasantly exemplified. Grapefruit needs sugar, Aperol needs Prosecco, and radicchio, the star of this post, needs a great garlic marinade. Most people shy away from radicchio because lazy chefs around the world just toss it […]

item.title: Live Well, Drink Well : Greenhouse Juice Co.
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: Does anyone else happen to find juicers a little bit sexy? Im not talking about the $300 mini ones that take hours to clean, but the industrial ones that pulverize whole fruits and vegetables to pulp- free liquid faster than you can say ‘zzzzip’. I think I fall in love every time I watch a […]

item.title: I Love You More Than Coffee, But Not Always Before
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: I’m at that point in the year where I need a change of scenery but I  don’t want to (can’t afford to) spend any money. I want to get out of my house on the weekend, but I don’t want to spend money at the bar. I want to walk my dog 4x a day, […]

item.title: Happy Is Sexy : How To Say No To Winter Blues
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: Not only is it February 28th today, it also happens to be the last day of February, meaning two whole months have passed since that drunken stumble into 2014. It’s that time of the year where we seriously consider moving to Zanzibar or Hvar to avoid the bone- whipping negative temperatures. HOW IS IT STILL […]

item.title: To Love Would Be An Awfully Big Adventure
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: As I sat down to write this post I wondered how my words for this year’s Valentines Day would differ from what I said last year, and the year before that, and so on.  It took me a good 10 minutes to realize that playing some love songs was pertinent and persisted to pour myself […]

item.title: To Eat Is An Art: Seven Chefs & A Five-Way
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: Although Winterlicious wins in forcing much needed get-togethers during the coldest time of the year, I knew our love affair was over when I began being seduced by the main menu, never to look another Prix Fixe in the eyes again *sigh*. Yes, it’s a great way to test a restaurant on a budget, but I have […]

item.title: Soup City : Mushroom Dumpling French Onion Soup
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: I have always found it poetic that French Onion soup relies on Spanish onions for its sweet, savoury satisfying taste. Yes, it’s true that the glutton in all of us orders this dish for the overwhelming amount of melted gruyere and soft slurpy chunks of fresh bread. However, the real showstopper should be the broth, […]

item.title: Body Fuel: Getting Jiggy With Ginger
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: After four months of putting up with piercing cold winds, ice blanket slip n’ slides and enough snowfall to make me never want to leave my house again, I am beginning to fear that the inevitable cold, flu and/or throat infection is about to hit. Although I wouldn’t mind the opportunity to be bed-ridden for […]

item.title: Have You Seen This? Faith In Humanity Restored
item.dc:creator: The Torontonian
item.description: My first thought while watching this video is that it might just be one of the best things I have ever witnessed in my entire twenty- two (twenty-three?) years of life. A f*cking plus for the Grammy’s: this is the kind of positive messages we need to not only be sending, but actively participating in. […]
